meanings.definition: A person who displays or presents something for others to see.
meanings.sent1: The exhibitors set up their artwork at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: Many exhibitors showcased their inventions at the science fair.
meanings.sent3: The exhibitors at the zoo made the animals feel like celebrities.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was an exhibitors' paradise, with flowers competing for attention.
meanings.sent5: The exhibitors at the market were eager to attract customers with their unique products.

meanings.definition: A company or organization that showcases products or services at an event.
meanings.sent1: The exhibitors at the trade show displayed their latest technology.
meanings.sent2: Local businesses were the main exhibitors at the community expo.
meanings.sent3: The exhibitors at the food festival made everyone's taste buds dance.
meanings.sent4: The exhibitors' booths at the fair were like colorful islands in a sea of people.
meanings.sent5: Visitors flocked to the exhibitors' stalls at the convention to learn about new products.

meanings.definition: The act of showing or presenting something to an audience.
meanings.sent1: The exhibitors of the play received a standing ovation.
meanings.sent2: Exhibitors of the fashion show strutted confidently on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The magician's exhibitors left the audience in awe and wonder.
meanings.sent4: The exhibitors of the talent show shone brightly under the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The exhibitors of the art exhibition captivated visitors with their creativity.
